properties.areaDesc: Laramie, WY; Goshen, WY; Albany, WY; Platte, WY
properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 8 at 5:41PM MST until February 8 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
At 541 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from near Hawk Springs to near Hutton Lake, moving
southeast at 40 mph.

HAZARD...Poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts
up to 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar and webcams.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 18 and
50.

Locations impacted include...
La Grange, Iron Mountain, Federal, Hawk Springs Campground, Hawk
Springs Recreation Area, Whitaker, Horse Creek, Meriden Rest Area,
Hawk Springs and Ranchettes.
properties.instruction:
Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the
visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

Serious injuries and deaths may result from people exiting their
vehicles during a snow squall. Drivers may not be able to see you or
to stop! If stopped on the roadway or involved in an accident,
quickly exit your vehicle move as far away from the roadway as
possible ONLY when it is safe to do so. Do not stand along or near
the roadway, since approaching vehicles may be unable to maintain
control.

NWSheadline: A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM MST FOR EAST CENTRAL ALBANY...SOUTHERN GOSHEN...NORTHERN LARAMIE AND SOUTHEASTERN PLATTE COUNTIES
